Der er øl i topklasse. Fadlagret på egetræs fade smages og øllen fremstår smagsmæssig fyldig og vinøs med en let syrlig smag som afløses af en let sødme med smag af rosin og blomme. Det er nydelse i top klasse og så holder den 13% 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Slightly lighter amber than the Nuits. Bread, pit fruit and spice, with more than a hint of barrel and alcohol. Also quite good, just a step behind the other.
Aroma of barrel oak.taste or sweet and dried fruits,malt.quite complex belgian strong ale.

Laranja escura, espuma amarelada de média formação e persistência. No aroma prevalece o amadeirado de média intensidade, whisky, alcoólica. Malte evidente que resulta em um sabor diferenciado. Muito boa.

superbe robe dorée, mousse crémeuse. Nez dune rare complexité où lon retrouve des arômes de fruits confits, de fruits mûrs, de malt, dépices douces sur un fond boisé parfaitement intégré et une note vineuse. Bouche tout aussi grandiose avec une attaque ample, riche, puissante, chaleureuse tout en restant fraîche, bulle onctueuse et longue finale complexe. Un délice absolu.

This one has a bit of age on it... Pours orange amber into a tulip. white head with little retention recedes to hug rim. Hot, overripe fruit aromas. Medium bodied with hot apricot, plum and dusty yeast upfront turning to hot toffee in the lasting finish. Nicely hot.

75cl bottle, shared at Olut Sabadell in Tuesdays taste sessions.
Golden honey colour with a nice white head.
Malty aroma, with toffe and caramel. Plenty of wood.
Sweety in taste with alcohol just warming, white whine notes and that hint of "coke" of old belgian beers.
Al club de tast de lOlut (Sabadell). Impresionant belga en barrica. 13 graus molt ben portats. Es nota la fusta pels 4 costats!

750ml bottle 2010 vintage. Pours out a burnt orange topped with a sand head. Nose has tons going on barrel oak lots of fruit citrus pit caramel sweetness. Taste is more of the layers of complexity barrel oak fruit and sweetness.

13%-os belgian strong ale tölgyfa hordóban érlelve, helyezhetjük képbe magunkat a főzet mibenlétét illetően, ilyen előjelek mentén nyilvánvalóan csak a legjobbra számít az ember. Ha a küllemén múlna, aggodalomra sem lenne semmi okunk a továbbiakban sem, borostyán színe és hófehér ködhabja festői vonalakat rajzolnak. Illata a jól ismert sárga gyümölcsök üde bukéjának fuvallatával indít, enyhe fanyar szellő kíséretében, s egy tartalmas barackpálinkás, gyümölcsmagos hangulat is kiérződik az aromafellegből. Az már korántsem ennyire örömteli, hogy egy kilógó mellékzönge is rendre ott munkálkodik már ebben a fázisban is, egyfajta nyers, ipari, valamiféle kaucsukszármazékot idéző illatjegy, mely talán megmagyarázhatatlan módon csak arra az egyetlen palackra jellemző, amit a kezemben tartok, én sehogyan sem tudtam megbarátkozni vele. Az érlelés karakterisztikája természetesen tetten érhető az italban, a mazsolás, kandiscukros, desszertszerű elemek is éppúgy megjelennek, mint a kissé fanyar élesztős, fás jegyek, majd csípős és szigorú, mégis elegánsan jelen lévő alkoholos köntös, s a nem csak jelzés értékkel bíró aromás komló zárása. Idővel az élénksége is csitul kissé, így válik némileg barátibbá a számomra a szerkezet, s az a gumisba forduló mellékíz is visszavesz kissé a tolakodásból, átadva a helyét azoknak a komponenseknek, amelyeknek valóban a sörben a helyük, így alakítva ki a szimpatikus belga benyomásokat.

F: thin, off-white, diminishing to thin film with some small bubbles.
C: dark amber with red-amber tones against the light, hazy, opaque.
A: sherry, vanilla, oak wood, Porto wine tones, cherries, raspberries, hint of peach, raisins, hint of nutty, wonderful complex. 
T: malty, vinous, oak barrels, vanilla, cherries, sherry, hint of mushrooms, alcohol warming, spice, cinnamon, not very sweet, low bitterness, very nice for long winter evenings, full complex body, lower carbonation, very good, BB: 23/12/2018, 75cl bottle (12) from Match supermarket in Woluwe shopping centre in Brussels.
amber, golden, tan foam, bread, hay, caramel, medium body, full body, creamy, average carbonation, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness,

Lots of oak, alcohol, toffee, floral, grass, vanilla, caramel, light Green apples.
Amber colour, big white head, lacing.
Heavy sweetness, tart, light/medium bite, ABV evident, good amount of funky yeast character.
Fullbodied, soft carbonation, warming finish.
A treat.

75cl bottle shared at home. Hazy amber with a medium slightly off-white head. Full body with low to moderate carbonation. Well balanced sweet and bitter tones. Oak, ripe fruits, warming alcohol, peach, malts, caramel, vanilla and spices. Very good.

Amber color, small white head. A bit unclear. Apricot, oranges, peaches, sugar, banana aromas. Taste of dried fruits, peaches, bananas, yeast, brown sugar. Low carbonation, sticky texture. Sweet taste, slight bitter finish with noticeable alcohol.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2016 750 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Light cloudy golden/amber with a medium white head. Strong malty aroma, alcohol, oak, vinous notes, belgian yeast, some funk (brett?), resin, dried fruits and caramel. Taste reflects the aroma.  Medium body. Low to medium bitterness. Low carbonation.

Bottled. Pours a hazy thick orange, red and copper color. Thick soapy head, vanishes quick. Nose piercing aroma of tons of fresh fruits, sourness, white wine, gerkins, sauerkraut, alcohol. Taste mirrors the aroma plus a fantastic dry hoppy sour finish. Surprisingly easy to drink though the present alcohol in the aftertaste.

Bottle at 3 Brødre, december 15th 2015. Orange body with a thick white head. Aroma of dried fruit, caramel, wood and spices. Taste of belgian yeast with prunes, alcohol, citric fruits. Quite sweet throughout. Spicy and fruity aftertaste. Very decent

750ml bottle at Koht. Amber colour. Modest white head. Hints of berries, hints of berrywine, sourness, herbal and spicy notes in the aroma. Caramel, oakiness, hints of berries and wine at first. Caramelly notes, liqeury notes in the middle. Berrywine, alcochol, spices in the end. Quite complex, bit liqeury, alcocholy, but still enjoyable belgium strong ale.

Bottle, 2010 sticker on it. Pours hazy amber, medium kinda fizzy beige head, some residual and lacing. Aroma is vinous, sherry notes, oak tannin, some candi sugar, Belgian spices, toffee, bretty funk, vanilla. Flavor is light plus sweet, oak tannins and vanilla with a hint of funk. Medium body. Interesting.

hazy orange to amber colour, large, creamy beige-ish off-white head; aroma of vanilla, oak and whisky notes, biscuits, and fruits like apple and maybe some peach, too; taste of malty-syrupy sweetness with vanilla, whisky and fruity notes as well as hints of dark chocolate; great Belgian strong ale, but definitely overpriced

Bottle - as Cuvée Spéciale 2014 - from Beerexpress when they were still residing on Gonsiori street (was I think  20), shared with Mait. The bottle design is different, more traditional than the one pictured. Pours orange, opaque, no head. An armada of floaty bits - WTF? - the bottle has been standing still for half a year. Sourish papery hints. Some berries and red wine hints. I havent had a disappointment like this in a long time.
Pours an amber body with a medium head. Nice sour aroma with a hint of fruit. Nice rich taste with a very well balanced sourness and a fruity touch.

Look: orange cloudy with particles.

Aroma from glass with hefe: bread, molasses, brett, acet.
Aroma from glass without hefe has more acet and pore prominent woody vanilla notes.
Taste: moderate sweet balanced with moderate sourness.
Flavour: brett, acet, some rye bread notes.

Very good with balanced sour-sweet profile.
Juhlava omppumehu. Pojun 30-v malja. Pätevän makuista tavaraa. Juuri sopiva happo, kuten louhisaaren juomassa.
BOTTLE 75 CL. Clear bright amber, small head. Both aroma and the taste have mild acetic notes, oxidized wine and enough malts to balance. A bit of alcohol just spices the things up. Very nice.

Rich bronze colour. Murky. Thin head. Smells sour with vinegar, young wine. Very nice sweet taste. No alcohol for 13 abv. Beer tickles the tongue with almost no carbonation. Some acidity in sourness in aftertaste, which is less aggressive than the one in aroma.
UPDATED: APR 19, 2016 750ml bottle, tasted two years ago. This beer is great, very complex, oaky, vineous. Good to have bottle for ageing.

Un top de top. Juste incroyable de complexité et d?équilibre.Le nez est un parfait équilibre entre le caramel, la cannelle, la pomme, la poire, la pêche. Un peu d?alcool qui peut masquer le tout en début de dégustation, à laisser aérer un bon quart d?heure.La bouche a un corps très puissant. Les arômes sont moins dissociables qu?au nez, on sent énormément les fruits jaunes, la cannelle est en soutien bien plus loin derrière. Le caramel arrondi très agréablement le tout et la rend très buvable.Bémol : finalement peu de longueur. L?alcool ayant la part belle, le tout s?évapore très vite. La note finale reste sur les fruits jaunes à dominante pomme/poire, le tout sur un sacré fond de vrai bon caramel.

Cloudy dark amber color, lots of crumbs and floaters, small off-white head. Alcohol blow at first, than sugar, oak barrel, biscuit. Little bit of wine-like sourness, wine barrel, oak, coconut and scotch. Full body, soft carbonation. Comlex and beautifully balanced. //thanks to Alen

2008 vintage. Ive been storing this one for four years and decides Xmas Eve was as good a time as any to finally open it. 

Pours a very cloudy, dark golden amber color with dark orange edges and a two finger white foam head that quickly settles into a lasting ring. Streaks of soapy lacing left behind. 

Vinous aroma with a strong barrel presence thats nicely integrated into the elements of the base beer. Strong toasted oak character along with vanilla, rye whiskey and calvados brandy notes. Pretty complex and similar to an oak aged barley wine with hints of leathery malt, toffee, caramel and dark fruits. Some spicy rye and apple lingering underneath the barrel notes as well as hints of plum, raisin and fig. Very nice!

Medium bodied with surprising amount of carbonation considering its age and high ABV. As in the aroma, it feels more like a barrel aged old ale/barley wine. Complex barrel character with combination of virgin oak, whiskey and brandy barrel flavors. Toasted and slightly toothpick-y with dry oak, spicy rye whisky, and apple and brandy notes. Zesty spice compliments the spicy rye notes before being countered by sweet and earthy malts, bready yeast and dark fruit sweetness. Strong barrel presence but it doesnt overpower the base with hints of toffee, caramel apple, fig, plum, currants and dark cherries. Theres a decent amount of alcohol sweetness and some warmth in the finish but the 13% ABV is pretty well masked. Complex and flavorful but definitely a sipper.

small sample at the bottleshop. together with the other barrel version. poured a hazy dark amber colour with a few bubbles on top. nose of rotten fruits, burned caramel, tart. and sour grapes. beglian spiced yeast. malty. and wet cardboard. wine notes. unbalanced with again that strong alcoholic finish. bleh

A événement exceptionnel, bière exceptionnelle  Pour mon 1000 ème rating, je voulais une célébration digne de ce grand moment. Bien sûr, jai déjà dégusté cette bière, je connais sa 
valeur dexception, ce nest donc pas la première, et ce ne sera certainement pas la dernière !!!
Bouteille sérigraphiée classe de 75 cl, avec bouchon de liège qualité diam, et médaille dorée.
Couleur ambre roux, avec un léger voile.
Bulles fines et lentes.
Mousse beige crémeuse.
Arômes de bois de fût, raisins de vendanges tardives, figues, dattes, pointe de miel.
1ère bouche souple à veloutée, à limpression vineuse extrême.
Arrière-bouche riche de mille nuances.
2ème avec des tannins superbes, et de la vendange tardive merveilleuse.
Arrière-bouche longue et complexe.
3ème où le velouté de la texture accompagne les saveurs extraordinaires.
Arrière-bouche dun impact énorme. De la classe, de la super classe, de lextra classe !!
Longueur qui est un Everest de la bière, en passant par les sommets des Andes
Jambes huileuses, fines.
Levure magnifique.
Alcool qui est un pur modèle de ce quune bière peut faire, un cas décole pour les 
amateurs de quadruple. Il ne sagit pas bien sûr dun accompagnement des saveurs,
mais dune direction énergique comme le ferait un super coach, avec un dosage des 
capacités de chacun (ici je te pousse la levure, ici je te pousse le malt, ici je te pousse
le houblon ), et bien sûr de lharmonie de lensemble avec la classe dun chef dorchestre de niveau mondial.
Finale divine.
CONCLUSION : une bière qui est un plus quune révélation, un petit miracle (ou un grand 
miracle, selon votre degré de croyance ). Cette bière ne peut être classée dans un chiffrement
sur 10, et a fortiori sur 5 à laméricaine  , cest un peu comme les cols du tour de France
classés hors catégorie  Donc, puisque nous devons nous frotter avec les 5 de Ratebeer,
nous dirons que cette bière vaut 3 fois un 5, ou pour parler plus simplement un 555 sur 100, 
rejoignant ainsi par exemple la Westmalle triple (ce qui est, nous lavouerons sans problème,
une référence ultime ).

750ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Murky brown color. Small size, white head, stays. Sour, acidic, apples, prunes in aroma. Prunes, sweetish, twiggy, minerals, apples, malty in taste. Papery sour aftertaste. So messy.

750ml bottle (300e of overpriced beer tasting) - thanks martjoobolut!
Rubbery aroma, some apple, in fact cider. Harsh palate. Have I thrown up in my mouth, as this is so acidic, and really unpleasant. Some wininess, sharp and harsh. Not wine - champagne, and very harsh and acidic. A style I pretty much detest.
Bottle in Brussels. Nice orange body with big head. Nose is sweet, grapes, malt and sourness. Taste lots of sugar, fruits and raisins. Some caramel and toffee. What a nice blend. Really well done.

Bottle. Pours amber with beige head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is sweet, malt, sourness, apricot, peach. Flavor is sweet, malt, fruits, apricots, peach, oak. Finish is sweet and bitter with some alcohol. Overall: great brew.

Slightly hazy amber, small off-white head. Nose is fruity, tart vinous notes, some sugars, apple peel, figs. Flavor is sugars and malt, fruit notes, hop notes, dryness in the finish. Dry palate. Flavor is somewhat simplistic and empty.

Slight golden pour. Big white head that subsides quickly. Little lacing. Nose is sugary sweet with some hops. Not very smooth in the mouth either. Not very rich as well. Taste is a very dry sweetness. Okay, but definitely not worth the money charged. Anywhere.
Bottle, 750 ml form Svijet Piva. Shared with Miro and JFK10000. Pours orange, off-white head. Sweet, caramel malts, ripe fruits, wood, some yeast, bit sourish, complex. Interesting and complex brew.
Bärnstensfärgad med dragning åt rött. Beige skum. Doft av torkad frukt, karamell, vanilj, alkohol och trä. I smaken tillkommer viss kryddighet. Avslutande fruktig alkohovärme.

Bottle, 75cL. Home. With dad & mom. A clear orange amber beer with light brown hues ; some yeast sediments ; small white head with a small retention. Woody aroma, fruits (grape, prune), alcohol. Medium to heavy sweet ; warming atmosphere. Full body, medium texture, average carbonation, sweet woody warming finish. Overall, a great beer : warming, powerful, nice aroma.

750 cc bottle. Pours orange with creamy head. My first impression in the nose was something between champagne and lambic. But it is really sweet. Lots of fruity notes, from nuts to ripe fruit. Toffee and almost milky hints. The oak is very present. Very interesting beer.
Helder roodbruin bier zonder schuim. Smaak is uiterst complex met zuur, bitter en zoet. Heeft iets van een Lambiek en tegelijk een wijn. Rijk van smaak, een bijzonder bier.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2015 Bij het openen van de champagnefles een luide knal van de kurk die tegen het plafond schiet, gelukkig blijft het bier in de fles! Uitgeschonken in origineel craquelé Bush Graal bierglas. Enigszins troebel donkerblond /amberkleurig bier, met lichte crèmekleurige schuimkraag die vrij snel, vrijwel volledig verdwijnt. Zeer aangename aroma's van Belgische gist, witte wijn, houtig iets van keldergeur. In het Nederlands heb je er geen mooie benaming voor maar in het Engels wel: smell of barnyard. De smaak is uiterst complex; zoet, zuur en bitter tegelijk perfect in balans.
Deze Bush Prestige is een massief bier met een uitgebreid en volledig smaakpallet. Complexe tonen van: Belgische gist, brood, dan zoete smaken van karamel, honing en gedroogde abrikozen en rozijnen. Daarna tonen van witte wijn, cognac/brandy waarin duidelijk de houtige tannine tonen van de eiken vaten aanwezig is. De afdronk is medium lang, zacht zoet met verwarmende alcohol toetsen. Het bier wordt steeds donkerder naar mate je meer gistdepot uitschenkt. Nog nooit zo'n complex en complete Belgische strong Ale geproefd, met veel kenmerken van een Barley Wine, zeer uitgebalanceerd bier met een knap verborgen alcoholpercentage van 13%. Werkelijk een van de beste bieren uit België, van Brasserie Dubuisson, waar je wel degelijk de rijping op eiken vaten in terug proeft. Tegenwoordig helaas niet meer geleverd in de exclusieve champagnefles van weleer, maar in een normale 75 cl. bierfles met kurk. Werkelijk het geld zeer waard, voor de echte bierliefhebber, kan met gemak wedijveren met zeer goede wijnen. Maakt ook nieuwsgierig naar de Bush de Nuits en de Bush de Charmes.

Sample at En Öl- & Whiskymässa, Gothenburg, April, 2015. Hazy golden/amber, fairly small white head, quickly dissipating. Aroma is oak, dried fruit, honey, yeast, spices, dates. Taste is moderate sweet at first, with dried fruit, floral and bitter notes, some alcohol, going into more refined sour hints towards the finish with citrus, orange, dry, elegant white wine feeling. Big body, medium carbo. A big beer, with big characteristics.

Thanks to Alusmamuts!
Quite huge brew. Malty background, dried fruits, overripe fruits, toffee, nice oak touch, spicy yeasty. Lovely white wine characteristics. Astringent, anesthetic finish.
Light sweetish sourness with light bitterness. Well balanced and enjoyable brew.
Amber hazy with medium off-white head. Nice winey sour aroma. Winey sour taste well balanced with sweetness and some following bitterness. Some cognac notes.
Sample @ Malmö Öl & Whisky Festival 14/3-15. Dried fruity (for example raisins) with oak (especially in the aroma). Body is medium with a smooth mouthfeel. Also some warming alcohol.
Sample @ Malmö Öl & Whisky Festival 150314. Oak and vanilla, dried fruits, caramely and sweet with a dry finish.

2010 Bottle aged 5 years .... No carbonation upon opening cork ... deep golden orange pour, hazy with a slight off white ring of head ... aroma of oranges, dark fruits, light lemon, sour brett and oak .... taste is sour and of oranges, zesty lemon, dark fruits, dry oak, light vanilla and some spicy bitterness on the back end ..... abv is completely hidden .... smooth with some zesty bite .... finishes dry oaky and bitter with a lingering spicy bite .... very well done beer that is well balanced

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2015 0.75 bottle. Hazy, very dark amber color and a small, persistent head. Aroma of fermented fruits, sour apples, some sweetness, champagne. Taste is sweet and sour, kind of like a fruit wine. Medium body, slick texture, and soft carbonation. Finish is even sourer than the rest. Overall the beer is much different and much worse than Bush de Nuits; I suspect a spoiled batch.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2015 Rating #1800. 750 ml corked and caged bottle. 2013 vintage. Complex aroma is dusty brett, lemony, oak, vanilla, caramel, molasses, raisins. Pours muddy orange-brown with a thick beige head with excellent retention. Taste is sweet, boozy, oaky, fruity esters, savory, paint thinner. Oxidized; I think this has been sitting on the shelf for awhile. Foamy mouthfeel. Not bad, Im glad I tried it, but ill never buy it again. Its a little too boozy, too foamy and too oxidized. Not worth the obscene amount I paid for it.

750 ml bottle- Thanks Poisoneddwarf- Pours extremely hazy golden with thin off white head. Aroma is brett, very citrusy, barnyard funk, extremely complex. Taste is funky, fruity, a little overly malty, dry bitter finish, oaky, a bit too boozy.

Bottle at daks, raisin juice, not grape
Juice but raisin juice, meh its decent.

As the Bush de Nuits, another great beer from Dubuisson!
Hazy amber colour, with almost no head. Smell is alcoholic, with wonderful nutty notes, and wood too, almost a liqueur.
Taste is also nutty, sweet, fruity, raisins, wine notes and woody tannin. Great. Full bodied, absolutely. Amazing beer.
Deliciosa! Bem amadeirada mas equilibrada. Uma das melhores experiências.

Sample @ Great Arkansas Beer Fest. Amber pour with a lively white head. Nose is pretty interesting. Candied apple, ribbon candy. Earth shag tobacco and wood. Flavor of over-ripe red apples. Toffee crisp. Rich nuts. Slightly tangy port and wood. Some oxidization. Lively carb keeps this from being flabby and arduous. Interesting.

Kveldens siste på Julemandag i annen des-14: her kom julenissen! Iflg Sigmund er dette noe av det beste de har hatt på Cardinal, og det er lett å skjønne hvorfor, i hvertfall for meg som er så begeistret for belgisk øl. Uklar gylden med hvitt gardinskum. En symfoni av bær og blomster i aroma og smak. Elegant, lekker og fløyelsmyk. Voltstyrken er foruroligende godt skjult. Skal du oppleve bedre balansekunst må du kjøpe billett til Cirque de Solei.
Shared bottle at Cardinal. Pours hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma of light fruity malts, vanilla,wood and leather. Taste is smooth, weak sweet, wood,vanilla and dried fruits.

Shared bottle at Mandag i annen at Cardinal. Pours cloudy golden-amber with thin off-white head. Aroma of grapes, white wine, vanilla, alcohol, acetone. Smooth sweet-sour oak taste; vanilla, wine, alcohol.

Part of RateBeer Top 50 Belgium challenge. From 750ml into Julius glass. Nice deep amber beer with a good head on its shoulders. Beautiful pack with a bottle necklace label. Punted. Immediately you can smell the barrel sour. The most amazing thing about this beer was restraint: Ive gotten used to sour beers that are SOUR - its the dominant flavor characteristic and hard to consider the rest of the profile. This beer had sour with restraint, balanced in a big way by a barleywine-style sweetness and a lot of nice complexity. The other amazing thing: 13% but felt like 7%! How did they do this? One of the most sophisticated and beautiful beers Ive had, which is why its an almost perfect score in my book. This is a wine snob killer.

Bottle, 75cl, 2010 vintage. Ive been sitting on this bottle for some time (not literally, obviously). Pours cloudy, dark orange, sparkling, decent foamy off-white head. Aroma is malty, oak, butter and vanilla, dried orange, touch of alcohol. Body is medium, pretty foamy to start with, touch of carbonation, drying. Taste is smooth and malt-forward, semisweet, plasticky oak, fabric plaster smokiness, some acidity, a bit of sharp alcohol in the finish, breathy aftertaste. Decent, a touch too drying for me.

Head is average, white, frothy and diminishing rapidly. Body is hazy yellow orange with sparkles visible.
Aroma contains malts (caramel, light bread, hay), hops (flowers, pine, citrus fruits), yeast (barnyard) and oak (like whiskey without the high alcohol content), grape, raisin, plum, tawney port, alcohol, pear, pineapple and spices.
Flavor is light acidic, then light acidic and light bitter, followed by light acidic, light bitter and sweey and after that light acidic and sweet, to finish in sweet and bitter, sweet, light bitter and finally bitter.
Body is medium to full with creamy yexture and soft carbonation.
Great beer. It's different from other barrel aged beers as the barrel tastes seem more present. Complex. Lovely.

Pours a thin white layer, that fades slowly leaving some lace. Cloudy amber color. Good carbonation and medium to full body. Nose is candy sugar, Belgian yeast and hints of alcohol, flavor is smooth, sweet, fruity & hints of caramel. Nice clean finish. The 13% ABV is not really noticeable.

Bottle. Clear red amber beer with a large beige head. Aroma is fruity with notes of caramel, apricots, dried fruit, vanilla, oxidized hops, red berries and herbs. Flavor is fruity with notes of caramel, herbs, spices, apricots, strawberries, oak and vanilla. Wow, intense oakiness well balanced with a fruity yet warming dryness.

Bottle, in a Venice hotel room. Pours hazy orange-amber into a plastic Duvel glass.The aroma has notes of toffee, oak, berries, pineapple, brandy, leather, yeast, spices. The flavour is sweet caramel, oak, toffee, fruity (apricot, peach syrup, pineapple, red apple) with yeast and spices (clove, pepper). There is a warming alcohol presence. Truly a fantastic beer.

Bottle at home. 2 years old. Has a cloudy amber colour with a medium, off-white head that fades fast. Well carbonated as well. Fruity aroma with apricot, liqueur, oak, caramel and rowanberries. The flavour is even more fruity along with leather, warming alcohol and wood, and is pretty rich. Slick mouth feel, and has a light bitterness. A rich, fruity and balanced Belgian strong ale.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2015 Continuation of the Bush Millennium of 2000, one of the strongest Belgian beers in its day (especially considering the fact that the alcohol strength is obtained by fermentation only), matured on oak. Yellowish, finely structured, crackling foam, quickly dissipating because of the alcohol; colour a warm orangey amber with equally dispersed, minuscule yeast particles, becoming ever more dark and opaque with adding the deposit and eventually a milky chestnut brown. Powerful and almost intoxicating perfume, orange, pineapple, red apple, cognac, brown rhum, caramel, cloves, cake, buttermilk, honey, marzipan. Sweet honeyish and orangey taste, not cloying, evolving into a delightfully nutty maltiness, delicate woodiness, meaty, buttery, finishing peppery and brandy-like, very warming without becoming astringent, with some flowery hops for balance. Powerful luxury barley wine that obscures many similar products and so far my favorite from this renowned brand. Unforgettable.

Beautiful sour, unexpected flavor
............................
............

Had at the Great Arkansas Beer Festival 2014. Pours a slightly hazy golden amber. Notes of fruit and spice. Alcohol is not evident as much as one would think with a beer this big. Medium mouthfeel. Very nice beer.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden, head quickly reduces to a ring. Aroma is sweet, fruity, oaky. Sweet, fruity taste with a medium bitterness (also from alcohol), oak notes are present. 13% ABV well hidden. Good beer.

Appearance: A bit unclear dark golden color with a small off white layer. Do not bother if there are no head! No need for that.Aroma: Caramel, apricot, oak, vinegar, vanilla and fruity. WoW feels like nose sex. Could have me nose down in this glass for ages.Palate: Full body. A bit sweet, and an ok bitterness. Soft carbonation. Oily texture.Taste: Pretty much the same as the aroma. Caramel, apricot, vinegar, vanilla, oak and fruity.. Well masked alcohol.Overall impression: Mama mia. What a complex and lovely brew. And yet so god damned well balanced. Pure beer sex. Blonde/ambrée. Voilé. Légèrement sédimenteuse. Nez: fruité. Fine acidité. Boisé. Vin blanc. Raisin. Épicé. Caramel. Rhum. Fruit exotique. Alcool. Floral. Framboise. Prune. Figue. Abricot. Ananas. Anis. Muscade. Pomme verte. Cardamome. Cidre de glace. Vinaigre balsamique. Levure. Banane. Un nez absolument sublime. Bouche: tout aussi intense que le nez. Entrée douce et effervescente. Suivi d'un combat entre l'amertume et le sucre. Et ça termine dans le caramel avec une douce acidité du début à la fin. Sirop d'érable. Très fruité. Boisé. Vanille. Vin blanc. Levure épicé. Beaucoup des arôme retentisse en bouche notamment les fruits et les épices. Chênes. Traces de levures sauvages. Fine chaleur d'alcool évoquant presque le whisky. Banane. Une bière exceptionnel et plus que bien équilibré. Elle englobe ma bouche de bonheur. Chapeau.

August 7th, 2010 - The Scaldis Prestige is a Belgian beer, but it reminds me of the most pronounced flavors I enjoyed on my brief trip to Paris to stay with an old friend. Murky, brown and orange with a thick, tan head and some clawing gripping, its not necessarily much to look at. But beneath that crummy color are powerful scents and perfumes or orange peel, orange preserves, orange marmalade, and a dryness that could come from a whiff of orange pith. The beginning features the same sharp but refined tastes of orange marmalade, but well tailored to a drinking experience. Around the middle of the taste, the alcohol lashes out before leaning back and revealing a more comfortable mix of honey flavors, a blob of dijon mustard, and that same, distinctive core of orange marmalade. I love this beer for the way it transmogrifies flavors normally associated with a dining table into a drinkable beer without the slightest hint of the work behind it. Its simply a beer inheriting a flavor profile that beer should have always had if brewers hadnt taken so long to get to it.

75 cl. bottle @ home  I had the intend of buying this during its annual release but then I kind of forgot it until I saw one of the last bottles at a local supermarket / I have seen this one around plenty of times but always at for what I felt like were ridiculous prices, still expensive compared to other beers at the supermarket but definitely much reasonable  comes in a massive corked wine-style bottle with a card, making it fit into the mainstream high-end beer market together with Deus  very hazy/murky amber/orange with a big fizzy head  smell is weird and better than the taste actually, overripe vinous fruits, going almost into sour ale territory mixed honey & molasses, odd  taste is honey, vinous, vinous overripe dark fruits, tart malt, caramel, molasses, toffee, brown sugar, lots of yeast, funky, almost barnyard, hint of tart, some wood, plenty of spices, champagne, slightly alcoholic, bitter & slightly sour finish, tart  high end, slightly sparkling carbonation  easily one of the strangest beers I have ever had, more interesting than good (hard to finish the bottle really) but pretty damn interesting  given the fact that I dont really like the base beer, this is some pretty damn impressive aging, wonder how it would work out with a base beer which I love

750ml bottle from IPB.
Appearance : Clear amber with big foamy head.

Aroma : Lots of yeast with light citrusy notes. Light fruits and wood. Very light citrusy tartness. Slightly vinous.

Taste : Yeast and light wood. Fruits, raisins. Finish is rather spicy with yeast and wood. Slightly vinous. 

Palate : Fluffy carbonation.

Overall : Not bad but disappointing when compared to Bush de Nuit. This feels like a shier version of the Bush de Nuit. Still, very nice yeast, nice spices, great mouthfeel. Nice wood. Fairly complex and well balanced. Alcohol very well hidden. Good but too expensive for what it is. Definitely go for the Bush de Nuit if you feel like breaking the bank.

Aroma of sweet malt, molasses and toffee. Quite heavy notes of alcohol.

Bottle. Vintage 2005 (or earlier). Pours a murky amber gold/red with a small off-white/greyish head. Bottle from and with Ølkonsortiet. At least 6 years old by this point, perhaps even older. Aroma hits you with oxidation which has developed beautifully. Lots of port and sherry notes, a clear bourbon characteristic also from the oxidation, clear vanilla, burned figs and caramel. Actually, this smells like an old, barrel aged barley wine. Taste has a lot of the same notes with an accentuated alcohol component. Not as elegant as the nose, but I dig this beer beyond any belgian ale Ive ever had. Had it looked better and had the carbonation have been less dull, it would have scored really high. Really marvelous.

Poured into a snifter. Pours a cloudy, yellowish amber with a nice white head, with good retention, which leads to minimal lacing. The aroma is almost reminding me of a Flemish sour, tart, fruity, cherries, and golden raisins. Not a hoppy beer by any means, but that was expected. Initial tastes are of raisins, apples, figs, winter spices. Some oak characteristics come out once it warms a little. The mouthfeel is very smooth, especially for 13%. Slightly creamy, crisp and clean, with a very complex palate. I would love to get more of this but I am not sure if the price tag matches the contents of the bottle.

Bottle bought at the bottle shop near Erasmus in Brugge. A deep brown/amber coloured pour with a decent beige head. Boozy Belgian aroma. It poured a slightly amber liquid with a small dirty white foam.

It had a smell of ripe fruit, vanilla, spices, fruit candy and peaches. It was quite a sweet smell with an alcoholic finish.

The mouthfeel was smooth with a light body and low bitterness. It had a taste of ripe fruit, dried fruit, well it was quite fruity and sweet in general. I also sensed some dragon fruit and raisin.

Just as with last time I really enjoyed this beer. It has a nice mouthfeel and a nice balance and variety of tastes that I enjoyed.
Bottle. Aroma of portwine and wood. Amber colour with beige head. Intense flavour with wood,malt and wine.
Bottled. Light amber in coulour, white head. Nose of fresh green apples. Tastes a bit of alcohol.
Light amber to appearance. Aroma gives a nice treat, quite wine-like. Fiery taste with hints of yeast. Sweet, champagne and cardamon savor.

Nice slight hazy cognac colour with small off white mousse. Aroma is complex, fruity and woody with some spice, honey, sweet malts and alcohol warmth. Taste is sweet alcoholic with a nice touch of wood. Aftertaste is like waxy, sweet, warm and slight bitter in the end.

Bottle from a beer warehouse in Belgium, where it is almost affordable.  Bubbly orange with a strong head.  Aroma of brandy and apples.  Taste of tropical fruits with a bit of vanilla and wood.  Interesting.

cloudy orange, large thick yellow head.
aroma is woody, boozy, spicyt, cellary.
flavor is sweet caramelly, spicy, woody, boozy, faint flowery, whiskey?
i found it too boozy.

14-SEP-2009 @Ølbaren.
Orange beatifull colour with extremely high lasting head.
Boytris nose, very sweet, with loads of fruits like peach and apples.
Almost calvados like, and very wine like in taste. Is this the sauternes of the beer world?
A fantastic suprise this beer! To bad it is so expensive.

Older, cork and caged bottle (newer capped ones available in my area too.). Bought because I got any iBanking Job Offer today! $46.99 Bottle FYI. Cork was extremely volatile when released, but no gushing thankfully. Barely hazy, effervescent golden amber with a huge rocky white head head. A huge head for a barrel aged 13% -er. Tons of lace on each sip, full retention, a looker. Oaky, slightly boozy nose, caramel, cherry, and light rotten fruit in the back ground. Pretty musty. Taste is big and hot with cherry brandy. (kirschwasser), wood, and a oxidized caramel beer beneath.  A ton of champagne mixed with cognac beneath. Very boozy, clean and elegant, but not of the subtly world beating flavors you get from de Nuits. Very boozy (the 13% flavor is their to smack you back to reality), lively mouthfeel. Oaky and toffee. Dont know if this will benefit from more age.

Bottle - Pours a hazy brownish orange with a smaller bubbly off white head.  Aroma of oak, vanilla, tropical fruits, rich spicy yeast notes, toffee and lots of caramel notes too.  Flavor of caramel, toffee, vanilla, strong oak but really smoothed the beer out, tropical fruits, Belgian yeast esters.  Smooth and creamy...cant tell its 13%
Poured cloudy, very little head. Nose has vanilla, fruity malt, slight sourness, hints of peaches and lemon, body is full and malty with drying alcohol, then an oaky and slightly peppery finish.

Bottle at the RBSG09 grand tasting.   hazy amber with a big off-white head.   Lightly funky yeasty aroma with some sweet caramel.   Wood, caramel, and light yeasty flavor with some vanilla in the back.   Finishes pretty dry for its size with a boozy kick.   More barrel than I was expecting, and it doesnt seem quite right for this beer.   Thanks to whoever brought this because Im glad I didnt have to pay the ridiculous price for it.

Light hazy, light brown with a quickly dissapearing head. Aroma is interesting with notes of sour wood, yeast and fruity malts. Flavour is similar with a huge alcohol kick, simply too much alcohol coming through for my liking.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2013 RBSG09 bottle at the grand tasting.  Thanks to whoever shelled out for this.  Pours orangish gold with a fluffy off-white head.  Aroma is chiefly caramel sweetness with some orangey caramel and hot bourbon.  Flavor is boozy caramel, citrus peel, vanilla, fig.  Doesnt seem to be worth 50 bucks at all.
 
Re-rate: I had this again with a bunch of age on it and it was awesome. Big sweet and rich but not hot and undrinkable. Score bump from 3.5 to 4.0.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2009 Drank from a bottle into a chalice Brussels at Delirium Cage.

We bought this bad boy by mistake.  Dont get me wrong its very good, but not for the price.  

It pours an gold with a hint of orange and fluffy white head.

It smells sweet with hints of orange, and caramel.

The flavor is vanilla and orange and bourbon.

Bottle.  Wow what a price tag here, glad to have shared the bottle.   Pours a mahogany body with a thin lacing of bubbles.  Nice whiskey notes, vanilla, and dark fruit.  Woody with a molasses and maple sweetness.  Great brew. Just a bit much for the $ tag.
Bottle. Fruit, malt, yeast and spice aroma. Hazy deep golden color with a white head. Sweet full and strong malt body with pleasant notes of alcohol and fruits. Very nice warm alcohol palate. Nice.

The taste of this beer is unlike anything, ive ever had. Since it is stored in Bourbon barrels, the taste of bourbon is primary and overpowering from the rest of the flavors. Got the malts and dark fruit flavors make this a once in the life time beer. Almost worth the full price to buy, but still worth a try

Bottle. 
Cloudy amber body with a off white head and nice lacings. 
Aroma is raisins, prunes, wood, alcohol and hints of yeast. 
Flavour is raisins, prunes and alcohol, with weak notes of caramel, leaving a long vinous and delicious aftertaste. 
Great brew but expensive.
Bottle. Hazy orange body, with a small white head. Aroma is wood, yeast, fruit and raisins. Flavor is vinious, alcohol, wood, raisins, dark fruits and a lot of yeast.

Bottle. Cloudy amber body with a longlasting white head. Caramel, oak, dark fruit and a slight sour touch in aroma. Flavour is lots of dark ripe fruit, caramel, light alcohol, oak and vanilla. Very complex. Creamy texture. Lovely beer!

I thought this beer sucked.  Rust colored pour, with lots of butterscotch in the aroma.  The brew is really lively--and the carbonation is way too high for my liking.  The taste is really malty, but the butterscotch flavor comes on seriously strong in the dry finish.  $45 a bottle here in Ohio, and I wouldnt drink this again if it were $5.

Mmmmm,  oak bombs.  Orange with a fluffy white head.  Fresh fresh fresh oak in the aroma and flavor backed up with a bit of butterscotch,  caramel malts, and alcohol.  It has a nice vanilla back note from the oak.  Snappy champagne style carbonation.

My girlfriend got this and I was lucky enough to try some. Pours a deep orangish amber pour with thick off white head. Aroma of sweet banana, light oak, some belgian yeast. Flavor is sweet, bready, with light oak and vanilla notes. A bit of apple, caramel. Flavors keep coming out of this one. Its very obviously belgian. Alcohol is there and noticeable but its never hot. Nice mouthfeel, well carbonated. Delicious, wonderful belgian.

Bottle at Belgian Beer fest 2009.  Finally, I get to try this beer without spending $40.  Well, I did spend $40 for the fest ticket, but I got 10 tickets.  This took 3 tickets.  Sweet.  Strong amber color.  Very good.  Some banana in the aroma.

Bottle at DuffmanSWs tasting.  Pours cloudy and orange with a large fizzy white head.  Aroma is sweet and very belgian with some sweet fresh fruit.  Flavor is strange, starts sweet and has a weird dry bitterness at the end.  Oak aging is not particularly apparent, maybe a little vanilla but thats about it.  Full bodied and sticky, but very highly  and almost unpleasantly carbonated.

Bottle courtesy of DuffManSW, thanks for sharing Sean. Somewhat cloudy orange pour with a decent white head. Odd aroma, hard to pin down. Flavor was very smooth for 13%, could feel the heat after a little while. Pretty good overall.
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Bottle: Poured a cloudy dirty yellow color ale with loads of sediment and a large pure white head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of sweet Belgian malt with notes of light toffee and some dry astringent oak. Taste is quite complex with some sweet apples notes, some sweet Belgian malt, light warming alcohol dry astringent oak. Very complex but still enjoyable and quite easily drinkable. Body is full with limited filtration and great carbonation with minimal alcohol. Very well done but not sure I would have this very often considering the price tag.

750ml bottle, cloudy amber hue, with a frothy white-beige head, yeasty, fruity, spicy, faint winey, oaky nose, with some toasted, caramelized malt notes with a hint of ripe, rotten fruits, with a sweet candyish,  toffeeish apple stick, faint maple syrup accent, with some green apple, strawberry, candied citrusy esters in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty, sweet toasted, carmelized malt character, with a liquorish maple syrup, honeyed, sweet mellow, warmth mouthfeel, with some woody, ripe apple, orange peel, candied apricot, marmalade fruity accents, leading towards a fruity, malty, warming finish.

2008 from 750 ml. bottle.  Amber color with medium white head that settles to tiny bubbled long lasting head.  Aroma is alc, dry citrus malt, some oak, but mostly alcohol.  Flavor is alc, oak, citrus, boozy, vanilla, cheesy.  Medium body with a carbonation that rolls around the tongue.  Very hot and cheesy with some port qualities.

Delilahs Vintage Tasting. Cloudy medium orange body. The aroma has alcohol and cherries. Also, oranges, apples and perfume. The taste has sweet apples, honey and a dry white wine finish. The alcohol is everpresent. Nicely done, but I wonder about the price for this beer.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2009 Hazy golden color with lots of little floaties. Complex aromas of wood, fruit spice and light caramel and raisin. Flavor is strong with dried fruit, carmel, sweet malt, and oak. Very good.

Bottle shared by bitbucket. Thanks Bob! Dusty caramel malts, ripe fruits, and some woody notes in the nose. Pours a golden tone with a nice head and sticky lacing. Sweet and bready, with toasted notes, ripe fruits, a little dusty straw. Huge champagne like carb, noticeable alcohol.

Bottle. Nutty wooden brettanomucs nose.
Orange brown, amber cream, champagne bubbles.
Fairly nutty, leather, straw, fairly wooden, a bit port, mango.
Medium sparkly body, fat mouthfeel
rich brew.

Cloudy amber coloured beer with lots of sediment. Quite sweet in the nose. The flavour is very sweet and alcoholic. Not my kind of beer, but not bad at all. However you can really taste the 13% ABV. Something to drink on a cold winter night. (Corked Bottle 75cl)

2008 Bottle from Systembolaget.
Hazy orange. Spicy, ginger bread, fruits.
Complex and enjoyable but not overwhelming.

Bottle. Orange color. Complex smell with hints of whiskey, raisins, orange and butter. Spicy complex taste. Fruit, malted barley. butter. Im sure this is a good brew, but I personally dont like this kind of sweet buttery flavors.

Bouteille 750 ml, avec bouchon de liège, obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Odeur dépices avec une pointe dalcool légèrement fruitée. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée voilée. Présence dun énorme col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Léger goût de malt, dalcool et dépices avec une pointe fruitée. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement fruité. (Rating #2156)
Pours hazy orange amber, smooth, toffee, caramel, wood vanilla, alcohol, little spice.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2011 Pours attractive hazy copper orange with a two finger off white, lasting head. The nose and flavor are cognac, toffee and butterscotch, along with a subtle dose of oak. Smooth on the palate.

750 ml bottle courtesy of JB. Pour is hazed orange, cloudy, with a billowy white head. Aroma is primarily the of yeasty spiciness, oak wood, coriander and an interesting ginger sweetness. Behind that is even some citrus fruit.  Very and engaging interesting nose.  Taste is big ginger, sweet, orange peel, slightly salty, some acidity present, and the vanilla woodiness from the oak.  Nice clean taste. Palate is medium and coating. Clean and drinkable.  Thanks for sharing this one JB!

pricey 750ml bottle from discount liquors, south bend and shared with monica to ring in 2009....pours a moderately hazy/cloudy cider brown with a thin white and quickly dissipating head.... a very woody oak aroma intermixed with vanilla and sweet ripened fruit. more vanilla and toffee arrive in the aftermath.... crisp and lively flavors comprising mostly of oak that also exemplified a delicate tartness.  more vanilla and wood flavors which quickly assimilate with newly joined fruit flavors.  semi-dry finish, lively carbonation, almost champagne like feel make this beer worthy of a try although not for the pricetag.  abv was nearly undetectable.

75 cl bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Hazy amber color, nice off-white head. Aroma is carmal malt sweetnes, spicy and some alcohol. Flavor is very sweet, with wood, spices and alcohol. Dry finish. Lovely.

Bottle that I picked up at Dranken Geers March 08 and consumed 01-01-09. Got to be honest I was a little dissapointed by this it poured a hazy orange amber but was as flat as a witches tit, not a bubble or even sign of filmy head in sight. There was plenty of oaky vanilla flavours, bit sweet, rich and tangy, typically Belgian in many ways but to be honest Iost interest in it and wonder whether my bottle was lacking. A6 A3 F6 P3 OV14   3.2

Excellent strong beer. The oak barrels complement this beer, the wood and vanilla adding a level of complexity and smoothness, as opposed to dominating the beer.  Thick and very rich, yet the orange color and frothy head still impart a sense of lightness. nice yeast. linger like port.

Botella shared at a family gathering. Hazy deep orange colour. Nice sweet fruity and yeasty alco aroma. Good filling mouthfeel. The flavour is sweet and fruity with alcohol, yeast, malt and mild wood. Fruity bitter finish. Hides the 13% alc. pretty well.

750mL bottle, courtesy of bitbucket.  Thanks, Bob!  Pours a dense, tarnished orange color; thin off-white head with medium-bubbled patchy lacing.  Loads of dried oranges, peppery yeast, and honey in the aroma; complex, restrained sweetness, nicely yeasty.  Medium-to-full mouthfeel: chewy, dense yeastiness, peppery / white pepper, effervescent carbonation; very peppery and yeasty, Champagne-like beer; mouthwatering and musty.  Lengthy finish: pepper, yeast, solid breadiness, and nicely dry and toasty throughout.

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2008 750ml Bottle:  Aroma of bubblegum, champagne, alcohol, oak, wood, and light yeast.  Poured orange/amber in color with a small, fizzy, loose, off-white head that lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Very sparkling.  Full of particles of all sizes throughout.  Flavor is light to medium sweet.  Tastes of wood, oak, tar, tobacco, whiskey/bourbon, caramel, vanilla, and fruit.  Medium body.  Mouth-feel is strange; it is so carbonated that the air blows my mouth up like a balloon when the beer is in my mouth.  Fizzy, then chalky texture.  Sweet, woody, caramel finish is dry.  Over-carbonated. Literally required a belch after each sip to expel excess air.  13%ABV well hidden.  I cannot believe this bottle cost me $40.  What a waste.  Very disappointing.
I tasted this beer before I got my account with ratebeer, so I cant really remember all the flavors.

A hazy dark amber colored beer, with a nice foamy off-white head. It leaves a beautifull lace on the glass. The aroma is great, sweet, caramel, fruits, like cherry, a little port. There is some vanilla with some spices. The taste is also great. Flavors of toffies, with fruits like cherries and other dark fruits. Some spices like coriander. There is a porto taste. And the end some nice bitter. The beer leaves a warm feeling in your mouth.

caramel, chocolate, herbs, vanilla, woody, amber, orange, clear, aminimal head, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, full body, soft carbonation, long finish, 
outstanding experience

75 cl bottle, thanks ekstedt. Orange, cloudy, with a white, mostly diminishing head leaving virtually no lacing. Toasted notes, straw, flowers, herbs, apple and honey. Moderately acidic with an averagely long finish. Medium bodied, dry, with fizzy carbonation.
Bottle (75 cl) from Systembolaget. Hazy amber with medium off-white head. Fruity aroma with wood and coconuts, and yeasty notes. Very dry and pleasant. Alcohol well hidden.

0,7l bottle: Hazy red colour, with a nice creamy head. Aroma of citrus, jeast,flowers,viny,alcy,and a fruity ending. Flavor has a smouth mouth feeling, with a dominas of oak, fruitynes , alcyand caramel. full body and a nice medium fruity finish. Nice belgian strong ale this is.

750 ml "champagne" bottle, courtesy of Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. Deep golden to amber colour, moderate head. Lovely vinous aroma with notes of oak, fruit and berries. The flavour is also pleasantly oaky and fruity, with a "refreshing" touch which is quite astonishing for a 13% ABV beer. Well, you get an idea that this is a strong beer, but not as strong as it actually is. It is not too sweet, and the aftertaste is moderately spicy. A great beer!
on tap at duck island. clear golden color with a slight fizz in the body. the alcohol really sneaks up on this one, well concealed with a great balance of malts and hops and a lively fruit

Bottled@EBF 2008. Hazy golden-orange body. Tiny coarse white head. Aroma has an inviting fruity sweetness, apples and cherries detected. Also a scent of caramel, vanilla and wood. Extremely flavorful; lots of  refined malts, acidulous fruits, mild spices and gentle bittering hops. Warming alcohol, and touch of oak and spices. Full-bodied. Lively, but still soft mouthfeel. Dry, fruity and spicy finish. Awesome!

Fairly large sample from 750 ml bottle shared by Tmoney99.  This one pours a hazy amber color with a large beige head that leaves sporadic lacing.  The aroma is rich malty, caramel, fruits (peaches, apricots,...), yeast, and alcohol.  The flavor is big in many ways: big caramel malt presence, big alcohol, the oak does subdue some of the Belgian character and smoth things out.  There is still the yeast and Belgian spices.  This is a top notch beer.

Bottle 75 cl. Fantastic aroma of a good cognac. Small rocky off-white head with spare lacing. Sparkling and cloudy amber/orange body. Light hop aroma of oranges, heavy yeast aroma, heavy in alcohol, nice aromas of peach, pear, apricot cask wood and honey. Spiced, fruity and fresh.
2008 bottle. Hazy dark amber, medium to thick head. Spicy aroma of cloves. Fruity almond flavour with licorice-ish finish. Nice body. Great beer.

Really nice bottle! Big thanks to Bananaman for sharing this!

Pours a hazy orange colour with a nice white head.

Aroma is a bit oaky, with some dried fruit and spices. Alcohol is noticable, but in a good way. Slight note of whiskey and cognac? I don’t know, but it was something that popped up in my head. Probably because the high ABV, it’s almost like smelling a "finer" spirit.

Flavour is oaky, fruity, spicy with notes of sour apples and vanilla. Overall this is pretty, or no, VERY sweet with slightly sour notes. The alcohol is very integreted in the taste - it’s easy to drink though the high ABV. Also here it reminds me a bit of whiskey and cognac. It also reminds me of Orval a little.

Mouthfeel is pretty filling and good. Smooth. Nothing outstanding though.

Drinkability is quite high, or eaven dangerously high. I thought it would be harder to get down, but it was easy to drink despite 13%. You definitely need to be on your guard when drinking this.

Overall an intressenting beer, even though I expected even more due to the high price. It’s not really worth the money.

(75 cl bottle from Systembolaget, thanks deft!) On September 19, 2008. BB end 1011. Nice klucking sound when pouring, gets a 5 for sound! High pressure in bottle when removing cork. PArticle filled copper color, fluffy off-white head. Fresh, sweet, malty, some almond paste, alcohol scent. Sweet, spicy, yeasty, aclohol taste. Alcohol, bitter, sweet aftertaste. WArming alcohol. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness.

Cloudy orange color with a nice white head.  Aroma is amazing.  Yeast, bourbon, apples, malt and candy sugar.  Flavor is rich and complex.  I get notes of caramel, booze, wood, sweetness, malty, yeasty, syrup, spice...you name it you will find the flavor.  what a superb beer.  YES! YES! YES!

Bottle from River’s Bend. Poured cloudy copper color with a large frothy off-white head. Medium sweet citrus, yeast, woody aroma with a small alcohol tone. Medium to full body with a sticky texture. Medium to heavy woody malty flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish and small alcohol bite. This is a standout beer.
Bottle. Poured a cloudy orange color. Aroma was filled with fruits and caramel. Taste was a bit malty and sweet with lots of raisains and caramel.

(Bottle) Pours hazy orangey amber with a medium off-white head. The aroma is sweet, malty,  fruity, light yeasty and light hoppy with tones of mint fudge, caramel, candy sugar/burned sugar, syrup, cotton candy, mild marzipan, apples, sweet pears, canned peaches, cherries, dry oak wood, vanilla/buttery cognac, sweet oily perfume, grass, subtle spices, acetone and a touch of dried fruits. The alcohol alongside some spicy and syrupy tones makes the otherwise round nose a bit sharp. Unlike many other barrel-aged beers, the oak really has a mission to complete in this one. The flavour begins medium malty and sugary, followed by a light to medium hoppy and oaky middle that ends with a dry, spicy and light grassy sting. The undertones bring notes of alcohol, sugar, dust, wood, fruity orange peel and apples. The mouthfeel is full, soft, creamy and round but the sharp alcohol notes distract the palate from being truly delightful. Medium but soft carbonated. The aftertaste is sugary yet dusty and dry with hints of woodwork. Medium to full bodied. This is a good beer, but not one of my favorite styles.

Bottle shared by Crosling.  Poured a syrupy golden-copper color with a moderate white head that faded to a layer.  Sweet, lightly spicy malt aroma with some light tart notes and a hint of hops.  Lightly tart entry with some moderate malt sweetness, including some light caramel and some spiciness.  Moderate yeasty presence on the finish with some hops peaking through and undertones of soft citrus fruit.  Soft carbonation with a moderate bite.  Perhaps it was a bad bottle, because I wasn’t as enamored by this beer as many others seem to be.

A hazy golden ale with a thick collapsing off white head. A pleasant caramel aroma and candy sugar, herbal, coriander, grassy and wild vegetation and alcohol, In mouth, an intense sild carbonated beer, with coriander, wild herbs, light acidity and barn. A wild and wonderful beer. Rich and complex. A nice way to finish a tasting. Old Stock VI evening,  March 23 2007.

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2008 Had this for the first time at Beer Passion weekend in Antwerp.  What can I say, I like most of the Dubuisson beers but this one is incredible.  Almost like sipping a fine scotch.  The alcohol is not as intense as you would think.  I definatley plan to get more of this before leaving Europe.  Re-rate September 08 - Just as good as I remember.  I have to give this a boost because it looks so good in the glass and is so smooth and creamy.  Top notch.

bottle thanks to jrob_21.  Pours a light brown/amber with a nice off-white head.  Nose of yeast, malt and spices.  Taste of yeast, fruit and spice.  Mouthfeel was medium and very carbonated with alcohol warmth.  Not a fan, especially for what it cost me.
Draft in tulip glass. Pours copper yellow with nice white head. Fruit yeast aroma, spicy taste. Noticeable alcohol.
UPDATED: OCT 27, 2008 75cl, exclusive brew, from De Hopduvel Gent, very complex strong beer, balanced, hazy, good head, very good, beautiful bottle, but very expensive, a topper!

Bottle, courtesy Tony at Oldsmar Tap House. Dark, hazy copper pour, big creamy white head, with spotty lacing. Sweet, ripe fruit in the nose, peach, pear, apricot, caramel. Zesty, some spicy yeast. Flavor has some slight mango, clove, banana, heavy malts, brown sugar, smooth spicy feel, with hops in the finish. Yummy. Very smooth and very drinkable. ABV is very well hidden, dangerously even. Very unique and very great.
Absolutely stellar. The other ratings have done this fine beer justice in their descriptions, so a big "ditto" here from me.

Yet another kind gift from Mes. Smells like a tramps wet dream. Sediment at the bottom of the glass like dandruff on a geography teachers collar. Awesome. Really sipable for the stength. You can taste the wood, I don’t mean like in porn. Cracking. Belter.

This maybe the best ale Ive tried to date, but that comes at a steep price of $50.00 a bottle.  The pour is a fine hazy amber with a small eggshell colored head.  The aroma is rich and complex with some coriander, sugar, yeast, and oak being prevalent in its scent.  The Flavor is smooth balanced with touches of maple sugar, butterscotch, smoky oak and many other more subtle touches.  A great ale, and highly recommended when one finds themselves with a fifty spot and does know what to do with it.
oro buona schuima persistente note frutta secca alcoliche vinose legno in bocca complessa impegnativa buon corpo etilico da bere con con calma ricca di aromi

750 bottle, from sloth, you rock dude!  Pours hazy amber-pecan, with a small off-white head.  Aroma of rich malts, dark molasses, alcohol, butterscotch and spice.  Vanilla, oak and a little caramel, alcohol, spice and earth - pretty hot.  Medium to full body and easy carbonation.

Very unique ale.  Sampled at Oldsmar Tap House.  Aroma is that of a scotch or whiskey--very strong aroma actually--the barrel-aged oak gives it a dinstinct smell.  The flavor is at first similar to a whiskey/scotch, but then goes down smooth, almost like a cider in aftertaste due to the low abv compared to a scotch.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2008 Kindly offered by Tony at OTH Oldsmar.
Totally captivated by this beer.
The smell reminded me of a brandy/whisky oak barrel aged beer. The smeel/nose of liquor is quite present. 

The first sip is attenuated by a sweet aroma, a mix of apple cider/figue.leaving a little aftertaste of liquor. At 13% ABV, I was very suprised by how smooth this beer was. Very pleasant. There is a definite quality in this beer.
Amber coloured beer with small white head. Average carbonation. Malty caramel aroma. Full palate, little herby caramelish. Herby little bitter and spicy ending finishing off rather dry. Nice one.
orange coloured sparkling body with a little white head a alcholic spicy hoppy aroma a spicy bitter hoppy fruity taste with a alcholic bitter finish nice one

At a bar in southern Brussels. Pours gold with floaties. Sweet fruit aroma, citrus, a bit of a bite at the end. Finishes dry. Thanks to Chris. And no, Joe was not kidding. Three times Chris was shat on. Fun time, thanks guys!

Bottle 75 cl. Vintage 2003. Huge off-white bubbly head that mostly lasted. Good display of lacework. Heavy particles in flow with a lovely golden  amber color. Aroma of raisins, prunes, yeast, toffee, grain. Very Port Wine like with heavy vinous notes. Also wood and vanilla notes from the oak. Nice spicy underlying feel as well. Very full bodied with a lively carbonation and smooth and at the same time dry alcoholic texture. Heavy sweet flavor with mild bitter and acidic notes. Lingering alcoholic and fruity / spicy finish. Excellent beer.

Bottle, 75 cl. Bought @ brewery.
Orange color with a fully lasting creamy off-white head. 
Aroma fruits, some caramel, malts, bit alcoholic. Full body.
Taste complex: orange, caramel, chocolate, light alcohol, lightly warming. Best of yesterday evening.

Aroma: Orange with a huge champagne-like head that disappears in an instant.

Appearance: Sherrycream, Fruits, Wood and a wee hint of lemon.

Flavor: Hay, Butterscotch, Honey, Vanilla and Bourbon.

Palate: Liquid is quite thin but taste is very complex. Lots of carbonation.

Yummy! This brew kicks in at a 13%ABV but still goes down very easy due to the high carbonation. Extremely complex and balanced brew. If youre into oak-aged beers this is a must try! I paid 20USD for this bottle in Belgium and i think its worth the money!

Complex and indulgent beer, a fun experience. Almost worth the price tag. Shared on the sidewalk terrace of Moeder Lambic. Thanks to my friend Chris for sharing this, during the drinking of which birds shat on him three times. True. Poured a golden brown with tight tan head and yeasties swirling around with the bubbles like flakes in a shaken snowglobe. Were not sure how old the dusty bottle was, but the nose had telltale madeira notes sugesting a couple of years at least. Nose managed to be both malty and vinous, with sherry, dark fruits, calvados (apple brandy) and also light chocolate notes. Inviting. On the tongue, the sweetness blossoms at first then reigns itself in, giving way to a parching dryness carried by very lively, pinprick carbonation. Backdrop is like the aroma: fruity, malty and boozy.

Rating # 700.  750ml bottle from OBriens San Diego.  This beer had anything and everything you could want from a great Belgian Ale.  First glass poured a mostly clear light ruby amber.  The last glass was much the same in color but with chunks of brain in it.  Nose was amazing...hints of spice, oak, Belgian yeast and some dark fruits.

Bottle from WBF in Raleigh.  Glad this was a few tables away from us, as I got a couple of pours.  Golden amber with yeasty chunks and generous white head. Much better this way than paying for it  This is a big, over-the-top oaky beer, and quite spicy, too.  Got to have lots to cover up that 14%, I guess. Perhaps overcarbonated. A great beer, no doubt, but not really worth the price tag.
Bottle Beer 3 of PP Belgian Fest 08.  Thankfully didnt have to doll out $45 for this glass.  Pours orange with an off white ring.  Nose of sweet citrus.  Taste is sweet and very boozy.  Pretty nice.

Thanks to Walt for this beer, which he sent, believe it or not, as a gift.  Poured a mostly-clear amber with a fizzy white head.  Pleasant aroma of floral hops, fruits including apples and grapes, and a bit of alcohol.  Taste is a delicate balance between sweet and dry with notes of spicy cinnamon, apple, pear, white wine, citrusy hops, and alcohol.  Finishes fairly dry, though does not betray its strength.  Body is fairly full and reasonably carbonated.  Could easily replace champagne or serve as a digestif.  Nothing original... just skilled craftsmanship.  Nice.

(Bottle) Amber colour, hazy, with huge brief foamy beige head. Lively carbonation. Malty, woody nose with notes of ripe apricots and pears, dried fruit (raisins, prunes, apricots), caramel and lots of oak shining through. Malty, powerful, fiery taste with dried fruit, caramel, vanilla, honey, apples and oak wood. Fiery alcohol comes through with a friendly punch in a peppery, slightly acidic finish. Almost full body with prickly carbonation. Alcohol gives it a certain sweetness, but it stays within bounds and never gets cloying. Lovely beer, a combination of power and beauty!

Heavy head with and amber body that absorbs light the way a barley wine should. Heavy on the nose from the botttle. Should be consumed from a tumbler to promote aroma. Strong notes of honey and lemon and a medium body that was almost to faint with an ending that lingered for hours. Fantastic sipping beer and would be easily paired with  cheese and crisp fruit.

A very good and smooth sherry or portwine comes to mind when drinking this one. A real celebrater, in this case  for a closed mortgage for a nice house in the country, yeehaa!! Nice dryish finish too, although its fairly sweet. Good sipper, but where is the cheeseplate....??....

750 ml bottle poured a cloudt orange with fishys and a large lasting light amber head. Aromas of apples, oak, light carmel, light vanilla, spice and a hint of coconut. Palate was medium boidied and smooth. Flavors of oak, vanilla, light carmel, light fruitiness and a hint of spice with a smooth lingering woody finish. A very tasty brew but not worth $40 a bottle!

Bottle purchased at Liquor Max in Loveland, CO.  Pours hazy orange with a huge, fizzy, off-white head, lasting with excellent lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (bread, straw, cereal), heavy hops (flowers, perfume, herbs), average yeast (dough, earth) with notes of heavy alcohol, apple, pear, and wood.  Full bodied, alcoholic texture, average carbonation, and a bitter finish.  Long duration, light sweetness, heavy acidity, and moderate bitterness.  This beer tastes quite fresh so a few years in the cellar should make it even better, mellowing out that raw acidity from the alcohol.

Corked bottle and served in my Duvel glass. Large ivory fizzy head that mostly diminished, patchy lacing, no carbonation observed, cloudy, and orange brown hue. Nose was ever so nice--malty, oak, alcohol, caramel, some vanilla and spicy. Ditto for the flavor with some fruit taste to it. Tingly mouthfeel. Medium body. A sipping beer for sure given the ABV, would be a nice warming brew on a cold winters night, and absolutely a beer that I would have again if given the opportunity. This is one of my favorite beer styles and it did not disappoint me. More please?

Bottle at Bjergtrolden.
Orange with a white head. Aroma heavy malty (caramel, wood/cask oak, dates, pepper, sherry), moderate hoppy. Flavor heavy sweet, spicy and moderate bitter. Full body. Really a gift!

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2008 750 of unknown vintage (but it came in a box with a big bottle cap over a cork) pours very cloudy amber brown with a big head with larger than normal bubbles.  It leaves no lace, but produces a fizzy sound as it goes down.  The aroma has got the oak and vanilla, with other BSA notes of yeast, spice, peach, white raisins, fresh cut grass, pepper, caramel, and bready malt.  The flavor starts out sweet, brings along some fruit, then a lingering honey, peach, caramel, and alcohol warming.  Hops are faint, noticed only when concentrating.  The yeast flavor balances to dampen some of the sweetness.  The vanilla really starts to show through in a lingering presence.  The oak provides some earthiness to make it even more multidimensional.  I find notes of cardamom reminding me of Indian rice pudding, or Scandinavian winter sweets.  Wow, it is so well rounded as it warms.  This is good.  The palate is quite rich and very carbonated to keep it finishing clean.  Overall, this is expensive, but if you rate it as if cost were no object  this is a damn fine brew.  However, Im not buying it again at the price I paid, and Im sure as hell not going to pour out the sediment - which in hind sight was a good decision as it made the last tulip even more well rounded.  I love rating and this is the kind of beer to keep it interesting!  Oh, and a 13% ABV 750 drunk alone is fun too.

750 ml brown bottle. Weird metal clip holds the cork in. Loud pop released the cork. Poured out a deep amber /  light brown color, with a huge tan colored head. Left a sticky lacing down the sides of my chalice. Aromas are of brown sugar cookies, molasses, dried plums and raisins, sweet malts, some tobacco notes.
Flavors include dark dried fruits, some vanilla, toffee, background coriander and cardamom, sweet malts. Alcohol is hidden very well. Hardly noticeable.
Highly carbonated, lively and fresh.
Medium mouthfeel, chewy texture. No noticeable hop aromas or flavors. A really well made Belgian beer overall.

Pours a murky golden brown thick off white head.  Notes of vanilla, biscuit, bourbon, and oak.  Flavor is a deep caramel, spice, coriander, dusty vanilla oak and bourbon.  Finishes dry and spicy.  This beer has complex esters and the oak does wonders to add to the complexity.  Bush is the true king of beers.
Bottle. Amber colour with a beautiful white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, caramel, orange, alcohol and malt.

From Magnum @ Kerstbier Fest, Essen. Amber color with notes of caramel, oak, prunes and raisins. Very complex on the palate and reveals so much more as it warms up. Dark fruits with a tart oak background. Outstanding and will only get better with age.

Bottle from Capones.  Turbid dull orangy pour with 3-fingers of off-white head.  The head was very fizzy and loud, but stuck around for a while, and reappeared at every repour, and due to the big carbonation, repours were numerous.  The aroma was oaky funky malt, sour mashy figgy fruit, champagne yeast, some old aley dusty fruit wafts.  The flavor was fruity in a champagney way, with some dusty yeast esters throughout, plus some earthy oaky malt notes, and spices noted late.  Very complex palate with a fizzy yet rich feel on the tongue.  This beer is marvelous.

Tasted at WBF. Pour: orange with sediment. HeadL off white and fizzy. Aroma: apricot, sweet, vanilla/oak, bourbon, alcohol, hoppy. Flavor: alcohol, thick, very malty, hoppy, vanilla, oak. Palate: thick well carbonated. Finish: warm.

750. Thanks, hogfodder! Im going to have to try this again, much earlier in the evening, before my tastebuds have been shredded by lesser beers. Pours hazy copper with a pale orange head. Lightly sweet flavor, with citrus, spices and oak. Any more definition is going to have to wait for a second tasting. Dry woody finish.

This is the first beer Ive ever had that made me want to write a review.  It is, in a word, amazing.  There is such a depth of complexity imparted by the oak aging that builds on an already extraordinary beer.  Vanilla, spices, rich fruit.  Just about every good thing I could think of is going on in this beer.  I wish I could find another to spend $50 on all over again.

The unique aromas and flavors of this beer are so complex that it is overwhelming to attempt a verbal description.  This was a very special experience that every beer drinker should be so lucky to have.  It if werent prohibitively expensive it would probably be the most talked about beer in the world.
Complex aroma that rates higher than my olfactory skills could process, being as drunk as i was. Pours a cloudy orange-golden, frothy head. Sweet and strong. Dry alcohol finish.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2008 I would have rated this brew even higher, but for the $50 price tag. Ouch!
Definitely a "sipping" beer (13% abv, with the fizziness to boot), with sweet notes.  It pours a nice fizzy head that dies away fairly soon. The nose bursts with grass, hay, coriander, brown sugar, the ocean, and wet moss. It is sweet yet smooth, with a finish like cognac or brandy. Definitely an aperitif beer.

UPDATED: MAR 29, 2008 Beware. When this bottle is opened it jizzes everywhere for about two minutes.  Pours a hazy dark orange with a light tan head that sticks around for awhile.  Also has sediment floating around in it.  OK flavor with a fruity taste and a bread taste too.  Drank this out of a tumbler. Not worth $40 a bottle.
UPDATED: FEB 2, 2009 WOW!!! This cost me $40 but it was worth it. It has a great head with a hazy gold body. The sedement is through out. The taste is amazing but the after taste is alluring.

Sampled with KieferUGA at the WBF in Durham a few weeks back.  Was excited to try this, due to it being too expensive to buy normally.  Forget what vintage it was; a few years back. [Odense-tasting at Scheffel. Bottle from Finn Planøkonom bought in BeerMania, Bruxelles.]

WBF. Got to try this several times. Pours a hazy amber with sediment. Nice thick head. Nice sweet aroma, vanilla, sour whiskey. The flavor is sweet, strong alcohol, sour whiskey, vanilla.
pours hazy orange with fizzy thin head.  alcoholic aroma. subtle hints of citrus, oak, and bourban.  Alcohol is well masked for the size of this monster

Bottle @ ChristianScheffel tasting. [thank you, BeerBiker]

750, corked and foiled, cracked at Uber. Cloudy, chunky dark toffee amber. Thick moussy off-white head. Towering green apple, dust, and caramel nose. Slick, slightly viscous body. Rich fruity sweet mid-palate with a nice hollow finish. Simple but truly lovely.

2007 Summer Secret Santa. Bottle shared at CapFlus tasting after GCBF. Big head. Dark orange beer. Alcohol and tangerine nose. Flavour is a delicate bubbly mix of alcohol, tangerine, and yeast. Finish is sweet vanilla and oak.
